Topic.Title: Bug with "continue"-style links and regular passage links?

Posts.EditableText:
I have several `+++Continue`-style links, these work fine, but I also want to allow user to digress a bit. It looks like this:

```
[[Intro]]:
Some bla-bla.

+++Read on

More bla-bla, also take a look at this [additional info].

+++Read on further
Even more bla-bla.

[additional info]:
Some nice, but completely optional flavor text.
```
[see in action](http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/squiffy/scratchpad/?gistid=00ab19414b32b904aea7e3819a074a6b&filename=continue.squiffy)

But upon clicking `additional info`, Squiffy renders empty passage.

Am I doing something wrong or is it bug? In both cases, how I can workaround this?
Thanks in advance!

Posts.EditableText: The `+++` actually starts a new section. So move your `[additional info]` passage *above* your `+++Read on further` section and it works.
Posts.HTML: The +++ actually starts a new section. So move your [additional info] passage above your +++Read on further section and it works.

Posts.EditableText: Huh, indeed it says "following section" in documentation. Sorry for stupid question then, and thanks for great tool!
